intro: Geniostoma fagraeoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant purple, pink, or white blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Geniostoma fagraeoides thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
